title: Constraints-Led Approach to Motor Learning Design: Nonlinear Pedagogy and Scientific Inquiry-Based Experimental Design

context.prior_knowledge: Motor learning theory and basic educational pedagogy knowledge, practical experience in sports science or related fields, foundational experimental design/data analysis skills (measurement tool utilization, variable identification)
context.additional_context: Nonlinear design methodology training for working professionals, applicable to real-world physical education settings, emphasizing evidence-based approaches through systematic observation, precision measurement, and statistical analysis. Learners cultivate scientific inquiry skills using exercise physiology data (heart rate, electromyography, etc.).

learning_goals: Learners will specify ≥3 constraints when designing motor learning environments using scientific methodologies (variable control, control group setup, repeated measures), submit an experiment design reflecting these constraints, and achieve ≥80% suitability in peer reviews and expert evaluations.

Learners will apply nonlinear pedagogical principles (iterative feedback, adaptive learning paths) and scientific inquiry methods (hypothesis-experiment-analysis-conclusion) to develop personalized training program drafts for 3 learner profiles within 4 weeks, meeting expert evaluation criteria (≥80% design suitability, ≥70% feasibility).

Learners will understand representative learning design concepts and apply them to real-world cases based on exercise physiology evidence (muscle activation data, movement efficiency measurements, etc.).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
